## Singapore's Largest Maths Tuition Centre 

For 2025 Class Schedule or Home Tuition, call 6475-0624 or click the Whatsapp Icon

cite14†Classes & Fees  

cite15†Home Tuition   

[Image 0]

2025 Classes Start in Nov/Dec 2024: Jo in Our Popular Small Group Classes (only 3-6 students) taught by MOE Teachers! ― Our Small Group Classes allow students to receive highly personalised tutoring, but at group class fees ($420/mth). Each class is 3-6 students only, and each student is taught individually by the teacher in turn. Students generally see a tangible progress in grades within 3 months.

2025 Home Tuition Enrollment: Enrol in Our Extensive 1-1 Home Tuition Programme ― Half of our students now opt for our Maths Home Tuition Programme. Home tuition gives the convenience of having a 1-1 tuition class right in your residence. Home Tuition students follow our highly established 1-1 Maths Syllabus, and all materials are provided by us.

### Welcome to The Maths Lab ― The Learning Hub for Primary, Secondary, and JC Maths

The Maths Lab was started by 2 ex-MOE Maths Professors ― with a simple goal of making the learning of Maths efficient, engaging & fun. Unlike other tuition centers, we have chosen to focus only on Maths because we believe it is where our core strength lies. We focus all resources on perfecting the Maths paper. This is why our students continue to ace the exams every year.

Your Maths education is important to us. That’s why we continually (1) seek the best Maths tutors, (2) created a dedicated syllabus committee, & (3) source for materials from top schools. Our teachers go to extensive efforts to make all academic resources readily available to our students. So that when our students go for the Maths exams, we have quiet confidence in their ability to outperform their peers.

  * One of the Largest Maths-Focused Tuition Centre in Singapore 
  * 74% of our PSLE students achieved AL1 or AL2 (2023 PSLE Results)
  * 7 of 10 of our O-level students obtained an A1 or A2 (2023 O-level Results) 
  * 4 of 10 of our A-level students got an ‘A’ (2023 A-level Results)
  * All teachers are full-time Maths teachers, most are 1st Class Honours Graduates (ask for our certs)
  * Our Syllabus aligns exactly with the MOE syllabus 
  * Classrooms are fitted with HDTVs & Tablets for visualizations
  * All materials fully provided: we carry a full library of in-house Math materials, Top School exam papers, and Popular Bookstore Books

Since Math Lab was started in 2002, we have now grown to multiple branches around Singapore, with thousands of students benefiting from our unique pedagogical approach. Together with our team, we promise to continue bringing you one of the most effective & engaging mathematics learning experiences in Singapore. 

### Get Class Info

Tell us your Maths tuition enquiry. We reply within 1 working day. 

Please include which Branch you are interested in.

Your Name  

Phone  

Email  

Tell us your request ― (Eg. "My P5 son is weak in Problem Sums, may I know if the Kovan SAT 9.30am class is suitable for him")  

### Welcome to The Maths Lab ― Singapore’s Largest Maths Tuition Centre

##### We are a Learning Hub for Primary, Secondary, & JC Maths. With many maths classes held at our various branches daily.

##### We also have one of the largest 1-1 Maths Home Tuition Programmes in Singapore.

##### For 2025 Class Schedule or Home Tuition, c all 6475-0624 or c lick the Whatsapp Button

The Maths Lab was started by 2 ex-MOE Maths Professors ― with a simple goal of making the learning of Maths efficient, engaging & fun.

Unlike other tuition centers, we have chosen to focus only on Mathematics because we believe it is where our core strength lies. We focus all resources on perfecting the Maths paper. This is why our students continue to ace the exams every year.

  * One of the Largest Maths-Focused Tuition Centre in Singapore
  * 74% of our PSLE students achieved AL1 or AL2 (2023)
  * 72% of our O-level students got an A1 or A2 (2023) 
  * 43% of A-level students got ‘A’ (2023)
  * We hire only full-time teachers, many are 1st Class Honours Graduates
  * Our Syllabus aligns with MOE 
  * Classrooms have HDTVs & Tablets 
  * All materials are fully provided

Your Maths education is important to us. That’s why we continually (1) seek the best Maths teachers, (2) created a Syllabus Committee, and (3) source for materials from top schools. Our teachers go to extensive efforts to make all academic resources readily available to our students. So that when our students go for the Maths exams, we have quiet confidence in their ability to outperform their peers.

Since starting in 2002, we have now grown to multiple branches, with thousands of students learning with us. Together with our team, we promise to continue bringing you one of the most effective & engaging maths learning experience in Singapore. 

## Get Class Info

Tell us your Maths tuition needs. We reply within 1 working day.

Your Name  

Phone  

Email  

Tell us your request ― (Eg. "My P5 son is weak in Problem Sums, may I know if the Kovan SAT 9.30am class is suitable for him")  

# 2023 Channel News Asia Interview

cite16†Read More 

[Image 1]

## Our Branch Locations

  * Bt. Timah Branch (near Farrer Rd MRT) : Blk 4 Queen’s Road #02-121, SG 260004
  * Kovan Branch (near Kovan MRT) : Blk 203 Hougang St 21, #01-83, Singapore 530203
  * Tiong Bahru Branch (near Tiong Bahru MRT) : Blk 46 Jalan Bukit Ho Swee, #01-874, Singapore 160046
  * Bedok Branch (near Bedok MRT) : Blk 210 New Upper Changi Rd, #01-703 (2nd Floor), SG 460210

For more information, click the Whatsapp Icon to speak with us. Or call 6475-0624.

## Our Head Teachers

[Image 2]

[Image 3]

[Image 4]

[Image 5]

# Our Small Group Classes

cite5†Class Info & Fees 

### Small Group Classes

We have Maths classes for all Primary, Secondary, and JC levels. For each level, we have two types of classes, the Small Group Classes & Lecture Group Classes. During holidays, we also have Maths Bootcamps for weaker students to catch up.

cite14†Group Classes  

### 1-1 Home Tuition

Join our Maths Home Tuition programme ― one of the largest dedicated Maths Home Tuition programmes in Singapore ! Home tuition classes are taught by the same experienced teachers that teach at our centres. All tuition materials are provided.

cite15†Home Tuition  

### 1-1 Online Classes

Our Online Classes (both 1-1 or Group classes) allow students to have Maths lessons right from your own living room. We will walk you through the set-up process, and all mateirals will be sent to you before class. At the scheduled class time, just turn on your computer & start your class!

cite15†Online Classes 

### Small Group Classes

We have Maths classes for all Primary, Secondary, and JC levels. For each level, we have two main types of classes, the smaller Intensive class & the larger Standard classes. We also have specialised Holiday Programmes & Remedial Classes for weaker students to catch up.

cite14†Group Class Fees 

### 1-1 Home Tuition

Our 1-1 Classes may be conducted either at (1) our Centre or as (2) Home tuition. Our teachers are highly experienced, and many are scholarship recipients themselves. 1-1 Classes are taught based on our Intensive Syllabus, and all required materials will be provided.

cite15†Home Tuition Fees 

### 1-1 Online Classes

Our Online Tuition allows students to have lessons right from their own home computer. We will walk you through the computer set-up process, and all required mateirals will be sent to you before the class starts. At the scheduled class time, simply turn on your computer and start your video-conference class with us.

cite15†Online Classes 

# Our 1-1 Classes

cite6†1-1 Fees 

## Our Commitment To You

The Maths Lab was founded upon a simple mandate: to create an effective and engaging Maths learning experience for Singapore students. Over the course of our work, we have come to adhere to two core principles upon which our success is built upon ― (1) an honest & direct communication with parents, and (2) the need to keep our classes small.

## (1) Direct Parent-Teacher Communication

From the moment you contact us, one of our Senior Teachers will initiate a phone call to speak directly with you as the parent. We feel that speaking over the phone allows us as teachers to more fully understand your child’s needs. It also gives you the opportunity to ask questions directly to an actual teacher (as opposed to a receptionist).

When you join any of our classes (either Group Class or 1-1 Home Tuition), even before the first class starts, the teacher for that class will also contact you directly by phone within 1-2 days. We do this to introduce ourselves to you, and to ask about your child’s Maths so we can better prepare for the first class.

Parents will always have a direct line of communication with their child’s teacher(s), and you may reach out to us at anytime. This takes significant resources on our part, but our experience shows that students make the most progress in tuition when their parents are highly vested in their learning.

## (2) Classes are Always Small, Always Personal

We created our Small Group Classes with a simple goal in mind ― to make Maths tuition lessons highly personalised for each student, yet still affordable to most parents.

Unlike other centres that have large classes of 15 or 20 students. We have kept our Small Group Classes to a maximum of only 3-6 students (depending on the room size).

We do this because we have seen the very tangible progress made by students when they receive personalised attention from their teacher. Small class sizes allow us to create individual lesson plans for each student, so we can focus the limited lesson time on the topics & questions the student needs most help in.

Large classes are economical, but we have seen how a large one-size-fits-all teaching approach tends to alienate the very students that need the most help. Our mandate remains to help students as best we can, and to do so, we commit to keeping our class sizes small and our teaching personalised. 

# Our Online Classes

### Our Credentials

Here at The Maths Lab, we are very proud of the work we do everyday ― that of training the minds of a future generation. In fulfilling our mission, we have tried to assemble a team of educators who are both proficient at giving instruction & also highly adept academically.

We have rigorous interviews & strict hiring practices; and today our team of teachers comprise of alumni from world-class universities.

cite17†Our Story 

[Image 6]

## 2023 PSLE, O-Level & A-level Results

74% of our PSLE students got AL1 or AL2 (2023 PSLE Results)  
72% of our O-level students scored an A1 or A2 (2023 O-level Results)  
43% of our A-level students obtained a distinction (2023 A-level Results)  
*Figures only apply to students studying with us the entire academic year

97% of all students improved their grades from the previous year of 2022

cite18†Register         cite17†About Us 

### MOE-Registered Teachers

Most of our teachers at The Maths Lab are MOE-registered. Attaining MOE-registration requires teachers to submit their A-level & university transcripts to be vetted by the Ministry of Education. MOE also does a background check to ensure the individual is a “person of good moral standing”, and without any prior infractions with the law.

We understand parents need a high level of certainty when engaging a tutor ― certainty that the tutor possesses proficient knowledge of the subject matter, and that the tutor is of good moral standing. We require our teachers to be MOE-registered, so that when your entrust your child to us, you will have the peace of mind that your child is in good hands.

# Small Class Sizes

Student-to-teacher ratios are important to us. Studies show that smaller class sizes correlate with better student participation & interaction.  Lesson plans can also be tailored to better meet the needs of individual students. This is why we keep our classes small and cohesive.

### Small Class Sizes

Student-to-teacher ratios are important to us. Studies show that smaller class sizes correlate with better student participation & interaction.  Lesson plans can also be tailored to better meet the needs of individual students. This is why we keep our classes small and cohesive.

### Comprehensive Materials

Quality materials & handouts are necessary for students to improve. Aside from lectures and classes, our take-home materials are the 2nd most important way we help our students do well.

Our teachers continually source for the latest MOE exam papers, the most recent assessment books, and the most updated school notes for our students. So whether you are working on Log Functions or Trigonometry, you will always have a complete and detailed set of notes by your side.

# Conducive Classrooms

All rooms are set to 23 deg C for productive learning  
Classrooms are fitted with HDTVs and projector screens for visualisations  
Our desks are corporate-styled conference tables with pine-wood trimings

### Conducive Classrooms

All our classrooms are set to 23 deg C for productive learning. And all rooms are fitted with HDTVs and projector screens for visualisations. Our desks are corporate-styled conference tables with pine-wood trimings.

### A Complete Syllabus ― With Step-By-Step Exam Preparation

We spend a significant amount of time & resources to create a syllabus that is both highly effective & complete. We understand that students have busy schedules too. Our goal is to create a syllabus that allows the student to outperform in the examinations, yet does not require excessive studying time.

The Mathematics exam paper can seem overwhelming at first, with numerous topics, multiple concepts, and endless equations ― but we are confident that, if a student puts in the requisite effort, they can master the required topics in time for the exams. Our syllabus is continually revised every year, so that we focus on the most relevant topics and use the most updated lesson plans.

# Corporate Social Responsibility

We have collaborated with an NGO & MOE to provide subsidised tuition for students from lower-income families. We conduct these classes at MOE schools on weekends. We hope to do our small part for the Singapore community.

### Corporate Social Responsibility

We have collaborated with NGOs & the MOE to provide subsidised tuition for students from lower-income families. We conduct these classes at MOE schools on weekends. We hope to do our small part for the Singapore community.

August 31, 2024 

 2

##  cite32† Help! My Maths Exams are near!   

By cite20†Dr Ng  | cite21†Maths Exam  | cite33† No Comments 

Students all around Singapore will no doubt face the anxiety of having to sit for all types of exams – and especially maths exams, since maths is a compulsory subject. But instead of panicking – a highly unproductive exercise – students should perhaps try to do their reasonable best. This article aims to provide a list of helpful tips students can practice when exams are near.

##  cite34† Revising for Math Examinations   

By cite20†Dr Ng  | cite21†Maths Exam  | cite35† No Comments 

You as a student may feel lost when revising for your math examinations. In most schools in Singapore, the preliminary examinations before the real O-Levels and A-Levels are usually disproportionately more difficult than the actual paper. Sometimes this is done to scare students into studying harder as their final push (when they do badly in the prelims). This article aims to shed light on a few good practices for students who may be burning the midnight oil.

cite34†Read More 

July 31, 2024

Most JC students would consider taking Further Mathematics at ‘A’ Levels only if they are exceptionally strong in mathematics or have a special interest in the subject. This applies even to students who intend to pursue math-intensive subjects at university level, including subjects like data science, information technology, engineering, physics, chemistry, or statistics.

##  cite29† A Math Tutors Diary   

By cite24†mathlab  | cite30†Math Tuition Classes  | cite31† No Comments 

What’s it like to see things from a Math tutor’s point of view — namely, our point of view! Here’s how one of us view students from a tutor’s perspective! We asked the tutor questions about his students, as well as and the joys and challenges he faced while teaching.  cite29†Read More 

### Why Doing Well In Math Is Important 

Maths is a very important subject for students in Singapore. It is a compulsory subject that students have to take from primary school all the way to the A-levels. In fact, doing well in mathematics is often a prerequisite for many of the popular courses in University, such as engineering.

Maths is also extremely useful in real life applications, such as when we pay for something and make sure we get the right amount of change back. In the professional world, complex mathematics algorithms are also used daily in the banking, engineering and accounting sectors.

Singapore students are often ranked near the top of world rankings for mathematics, this is due in part to the advanced mathematics curriculum of the Ministry of Education. There has been a steady increase in the number of topics covered by the Mathematics curriculum, moreover each topic is taught in greater depth and difficulty.

At The Maths Lab, we strive to make mathematics a useful and interesting subject through the use of visual aids, to show how mathematics can solve real-life problems. We find that when students realize the importance of mathematics, they are inclined to take it seriously, and ultimately perform better in the subject.

[Image 7]

#### Class Chats

As part of our online learning initiative, we have an internet chat forum for our students and teachers. Students are welcome to post discussions on topics and problems we have discussed in class. If you have a question, search the forum, and chances are you will find the answer instantly!

[Image 8]

#### SuperTeen Programme

Our aspirations for our students extend beyond simply doing well in the exams. To this end, we try to encourage our students to better themselves for life with a series of self-help books that we distribute for free!

[Image 9]

#### Online Feedback

Connect with you teacher on a daily basis! Students can now take a picture of their work and send it via Whatsapp or Email to your teacher for feedback. Your teacher will get back to you within 24 hours and you can move on to more important stuff.

[Image 10]

#### Helping Needy Students

Written in our school constitution is mission is to help every student, notwithstanding their financial resources. That’s why we have a programme dedicated to students who face financial hardship, to help and nurture them as best we can.

[Image 11]

#### Take-Home Practices

There is no substitute for practice. So every week, we give an ample amount of practice problems for the student to take home. Our practice problems are specifically selected to repeat and reinforce what the student learns in class that week.

[Image 12]

#### Getting to University

Seeing our students enter university is always a bittersweet moment. We are happy to have been a part of their journey in life, and we wish them all the best. Fortunately, many students do keep in touch with us, as well as with the friends they made here.

### The recipe for success

Each child’s learning needs are unique. We understand this and ensure that children with special learning difficulties can still perform well with our quality teaching methodologies. Our teachers are professionally trained, and will give each child the care they deserve.

### Confidence is key

Confidence is a crucial element to a child’s progress. A typical child has to battle hard to be heard in the average class size of 40 students during lessons. At the Math Lab, each student gets personalised attention from their tutor and our class size is limited to 5-12 students. 

### Help them level up

If you feel your child can have the potential to perform better, the Math Lab will help your child to reach the next level. 

### Exam preparation

At The Math Lab, we are confident that we have the resources and experience to help your child achieve their best. 

### Schedule a Math Tuition Session. Call Us at 6475-0624, or cite18†Contact Us 

#### About The Math Lab

  * cite1†Our Locations  
    * cite1†Bt. Timah Branch 
    * cite2†Tiong Bahru Branch 
    * cite3†Kovan Branch

### Welcome to The Maths Lab ― The Learning Hub for Primary, Secondary, and JC Maths

The Maths Lab was started by 2 ex-MOE Maths Professors ― with a simple goal of making the learning of Maths efficient, engaging & fun. Unlike other tuition centers, we have chosen to focus only on Maths because we believe it is where our core strength lies. We focus all resources on perfecting the Maths paper. This is why our students continue to ace the exams every year.

Your Maths education is important to us. That’s why we continually (1) seek the best Maths tutors, (2) created a dedicated syllabus committee, & (3) source for materials from top schools. Our teachers go to extensive efforts to make all academic resources readily available to our students. So that when our students go for the Maths exams, we have quiet confidence in their ability to outperform their peers.

  * One of the Largest Maths-Focused Tuition Centre in Singapore 
  * 74% of our PSLE students achieved AL1 or AL2 (2023 PSLE Results)
  * 7 of 10 of our O-level students obtained an A1 or A2 (2023 O-level Results) 
  * 4 of 10 of our A-level students got an ‘A’ (2023 A-level Results)
  * All teachers are full-time Maths teachers, most are 1st Class Honours Graduates (ask for our certs)
  * Our Syllabus aligns exactly with the MOE syllabus 
  * Classrooms are fitted with HDTVs & Tablets for visualizations
  * All materials fully provided: we carry a full library of in-house Math materials, Top School exam papers, and Popular Bookstore Books

Since Math Lab was started in 2002, we have now grown to multiple branches around Singapore, with thousands of students benefiting from our unique pedagogical approach. Together with our team, we promise to continue bringing you one of the most effective & engaging mathematics learning experiences in Singapore.

## Our Commitment To You

The Maths Lab was founded upon a simple mandate: to create an effective and engaging Maths learning experience for Singapore students. Over the course of our work, we have come to adhere to two core principles upon which our success is built upon ― (1) an honest & direct communication with parents, and (2) the need to keep our classes small.

## (1) Direct Parent-Teacher Communication

From the moment you contact us, one of our Senior Teachers will initiate a phone call to speak directly with you as the parent. We feel that speaking over the phone allows us as teachers to more fully understand your child’s needs. It also gives you the opportunity to ask questions directly to an actual teacher (as opposed to a receptionist).

When you join any of our classes (either Group Class or 1-1 Home Tuition), even before the first class starts, the teacher for that class will also contact you directly by phone within 1-2 days. We do this to introduce ourselves to you, and to ask about your child’s Maths so we can better prepare for the first class.

Parents will always have a direct line of communication with their child’s teacher(s), and you may reach out to us at anytime. This takes significant resources on our part, but our experience shows that students make the most progress in tuition when their parents are highly vested in their learning.

## (2) Classes are Always Small, Always Personal

We created our Small Group Classes with a simple goal in mind ― to make Maths tuition lessons highly personalised for each student, yet still affordable to most parents.

Unlike other centres that have large classes of 15 or 20 students. We have kept our Small Group Classes to a maximum of only 3-6 students (depending on the room size).

We do this because we have seen the very tangible progress made by students when they receive personalised attention from their teacher. Small class sizes allow us to create individual lesson plans for each student, so we can focus the limited lesson time on the topics & questions the student needs most help in.

Large classes are economical, but we have seen how a large one-size-fits-all teaching approach tends to alienate the very students that need the most help. Our mandate remains to help students as best we can, and to do so, we commit to keeping our class sizes small and our teaching personalised. 

# Our Online Classes

### Our Credentials

Here at The Maths Lab, we are very proud of the work we do everyday ― that of training the minds of a future generation. In fulfilling our mission, we have tried to assemble a team of educators who are both proficient at giving instruction & also highly adept academically.

We have rigorous interviews & strict hiring practices; and today our team of teachers comprise of alumni from world-class universities.

## 2023 PSLE, O-Level & A-level Results

97% of all students improved their grades from the previous year of 2022

【18†Register】        【17†About Us】

### MOE-Registered Teachers

Most of our teachers at The Maths Lab are MOE-registered. Attaining MOE-registration requires teachers to submit their A-level & university transcripts to be vetted by the Ministry of Education. MOE also does a background check to ensure the individual is a “person of good moral standing”, and without any prior infractions with the law.

We understand parents need a high level of certainty when engaging a tutor ― certainty that the tutor possesses proficient knowledge of the subject matter, and that the tutor is of good moral standing. We require our teachers to be MOE-registered, so that when your entrust your child to us, you will have the peace of mind that your child is in good hands.

# Small Class Sizes

Student-to-teacher ratios are important to us. Studies show that smaller class sizes correlate with better student participation & interaction.  Lesson plans can also be tailored to better meet the needs of individual students. This is why we keep our classes small and cohesive.

### Small Class Sizes

Student-to-teacher ratios are important to us. Studies show that smaller class sizes correlate with better student participation & interaction.  Lesson plans can also be tailored to better meet the needs of individual students. This is why we keep our classes small and cohesive.

### Comprehensive Materials

Quality materials & handouts are necessary for students to improve. Aside from lectures and classes, our take-home materials are the 2nd most important way we help our students do well.

Our teachers continually source for the latest MOE exam papers, the most recent assessment books, and the most updated school notes for our students. So whether you are working on Log Functions or Trigonometry, you will always have a complete and detailed set of notes by your side.

# Conducive Classrooms

All rooms are set to 23 deg C for productive learning  
Classrooms are fitted with HDTVs and projector screens for visualisations  
Our desks are corporate-styled conference tables with pine-wood trimings

### Conducive Classrooms

All our classrooms are set to 23 deg C for productive learning. And all rooms are fitted with HDTVs and projector screens for visualisations. Our desks are corporate-styled conference tables with pine-wood trimings.

### A Complete Syllabus ― With Step-By-Step Exam Preparation

We spend a significant amount of time & resources to create a syllabus that is both highly effective & complete. We understand that students have busy schedules too. Our goal is to create a syllabus that allows the student to outperform in the examinations, yet does not require excessive studying time.

The Mathematics exam paper can seem overwhelming at first, with numerous topics, multiple concepts, and endless equations ― but we are confident that, if a student puts in the requisite effort, they can master the required topics in time for the exams. Our syllabus is continually revised every year, so that we focus on the most relevant topics and use the most updated lesson plans.

# Corporate Social Responsibility

We have collaborated with an NGO & MOE to provide subsidised tuition for students from lower-income families. We conduct these classes at MOE schools on weekends. We hope to do our small part for the Singapore community.

### Corporate Social Responsibility

We have collaborated with NGOs & the MOE to provide subsidised tuition for students from lower-income families. We conduct these classes at MOE schools on weekends. We hope to do our small part for the Singapore community.

##  【29† A Math Tutors Diary 】 

By 【24†mathlab】 | 【30†Math Tuition Classes】 | 【31† No Comments】

What’s it like to see things from a Math tutor’s point of view — namely, our point of view! Here’s how one of us view students from a tutor’s perspective! We asked the tutor questions about his students, as well as and the joys and challenges he faced while teaching.  【29†Read More】

### Why Doing Well In Math Is Important 

Maths is a very important subject for students in Singapore. It is a compulsory subject that students have to take from primary school all the way to the A-levels. In fact, doing well in mathematics is often a prerequisite for many of the popular courses in University, such as engineering.

Maths is also extremely useful in real life applications, such as when we pay for something and make sure we get the right amount of change back. In the professional world, complex mathematics algorithms are also used daily in the banking, engineering and accounting sectors.

Singapore students are often ranked near the top of world rankings for mathematics, this is due in part to the advanced mathematics curriculum of the Ministry of Education. There has been a steady increase in the number of topics covered by the Mathematics curriculum, moreover each topic is taught in greater depth and difficulty.

At The Maths Lab, we strive to make mathematics a useful and interesting subject through the use of visual aids, to show how mathematics can solve real-life problems. We find that when students realize the importance of mathematics, they are inclined to take it seriously, and ultimately perform better in the subject.

[Image 7]

#### Class Chats

As part of our online learning initiative, we have an internet chat forum for our students and teachers. Students are welcome to post discussions on topics and problems we have discussed in class. If you have a question, search the forum, and chances are you will find the answer instantly!

[Image 8]

#### SuperTeen Programme

Our aspirations for our students extend beyond simply doing well in the exams. To this end, we try to encourage our students to better themselves for life with a series of self-help books that we distribute for free!

[Image 9]

#### Online Feedback

Connect with you teacher on a daily basis! Students can now take a picture of their work and send it via Whatsapp or Email to your teacher for feedback. Your teacher will get back to you within 24 hours and you can move on to more important stuff.

[Image 10]

#### Helping Needy Students

Written in our school constitution is mission is to help every student, notwithstanding their financial resources. That’s why we have a programme dedicated to students who face financial hardship, to help and nurture them as best we can.

[Image 11]

#### Take-Home Practices

There is no substitute for practice. So every week, we give an ample amount of practice problems for the student to take home. Our practice problems are specifically selected to repeat and reinforce what the student learns in class that week.

[Image 12]

#### Getting to University

Seeing our students enter university is always a bittersweet moment. We are happy to have been a part of their journey in life, and we wish them all the best. Fortunately, many students do keep in touch with us, as well as with the friends they made here.

### The recipe for success

Each child’s learning needs are unique. We understand this and ensure that children with special learning difficulties can still perform well with our quality teaching methodologies. Our teachers are professionally trained, and will give each child the care they deserve.

### Confidence is key

Confidence is a crucial element to a child’s progress. A typical child has to battle hard to be heard in the average class size of 40 students during lessons. At the Math Lab, each student gets personalised attention from their tutor and our class size is limited to 5-12 students. 

### Help them level up

If you feel your child can have the potential to perform better, the Math Lab will help your child to reach the next level. 

### Exam preparation

At The Math Lab, we are confident that we have the resources and experience to help your child achieve their best. 

### Schedule a Math Tuition Session. Call Us at 6475-0624, or 【18†Contact Us】

**Ensuring mobile compatibility**

I’m assessing the website's mobile friendliness by examining HTML and CSS. The meta viewport tag indicates step. The container's fixed width might impact smaller devices, so examining layout adaptability is next.

**Evaluating mobile navigation**

Interestingly enough, the navigation appears limited on small screens. Using media queries could enhance its adaptability, as the current code lacks these for responsive design.

**Wondering about navigation**

The flex container might cause navigation items to collapse on small screens without media queries. Using a hamburger icon or CSS media queries could resolve this issue.

**Addressing navigation bar flexibility**

The website's fluid container and meta viewport make it mobile-friendly. To enhance responsiveness for small screens, the navigation bar might need CSS media queries or a hamburger menu.

**Assessing mobile responsiveness**

The website is generally mobile-friendly with responsive design fundamentals like a fluid container and meta viewport. However, it lacks media queries for specific breakpoints, which are essential for optimizing navigation on very small screens.

**Assessing mobile readiness**

The website has the basics for responsive design. However, to enhance it for tiny screens, including media queries or adjusting the navigation for small screens is essential.

**Ensuring compatibility**

Adapting the navigation bar to very small screens might involve a mobile-friendly menu or media queries, as the design relies on a responsive meta tag and flexible container.

**Enhancing mobile design**

It's worth noting that the website's responsive layout could be further improved by adding specific media queries to ensure navigation elements are usable and visually appealing on the smallest mobile devices.

I’m adding a media query for screens up to 600px to adjust navigation and layout elements, enhancing mobile responsiveness. This includes changing flex direction, width, and margins for the `.main-nav .container`, `.nav-menu`, and `.nav-menu li`.

**Tweaking container dimensions**

I’m honing in on the container’s width and max-width, aiming to refine its appearance on small devices. This involves ensuring the layout is optimized for better mobile responsiveness.

**Refining mobile responsiveness**

I’m working through the CSS code to ensure optimal mobile responsiveness. This involves tweaking navigation elements, container layout, and text sizes for various screen sizes.

**Tweaking layout elements**

I’m refining layout elements for screens up to 600px, adjusting flex direction, margins, and padding for a more cohesive mobile experience.
